alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 14 at 3:42PM AKST until January 14 at 4:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...LONG DURATION SNOW EVENT FOR THIS WEEKEND... .As a system positions itself across the northern gulf, moisture is being steered into the Panhandle, with widespread precipitation enveloping the north and central areas. Through the day warmer temperatures have penetrated inland, with many observation sites rising a few degrees, with this warming trend continuing into Monday afternoon. Expect snow ratios to drop as snow becomes wetter and heavier. As the front moves southeast Monday afternoon it will bring accumulating snowfall to the southern Panhandle. For the north, expecting accumulating snowfall to end sometime Monday night, with clearing moving north to south through the day Tuesday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 4 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... Warmer temperatures are expected to slide into the area, allowing snow to transition to rain.
